section.title: Typographical Conventions
section.para: The following typographical conventions are applied to words and phrases to clarify the type of information that is being described. These conventions apply to inline text as well as screen output to identify what the remote system prints and what is expected by you when input is required.

listitem.para: Normal text that appears on the screen is shown using a literal type.
Executable commands are shown as ifconfig.
Useful information that you should take note of is in marked up.
If you need to enter something that is not visible on the screen when you type, this will be shown as Enter Password.
If you need to modify a file, the text to modify is shown using the replaceable markup, as this sample.

section.screen: Login: jcurl Password: Enter password $ ifconfig eth0 Link encap:Ethernet HWaddr 00:50:56:12:04:ea inet addr:192.168.1.12 Bcast:192.168.1.255 Mask:255.255.0 inet6 addr: fe80::250:56ff:fe12:4ea/64 Scope:Link UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST MTU:1500 Metric:1
